heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 24 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (225°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 564 m), feels like temperature (up 2.9°C), dew point temperature (up 1.8°C), and outside temperature (up 3.0°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 402.2m lower than yesterday, 204.3m lower than the past week, 564.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 794m and a peak of 2000m, averaging 795.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and it’s dim outside. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
